hints.content:
Multiplication and division are related:

$\begin{align}
\greenD{\text{number of groups}} \times \maroonD{\text{size of groups}} = \purpleC{\text{total}} \\\\
\maroonD{\text{size of groups}} \times \greenD{\text{number of groups}} = \purpleC{\text{total}} \\\\
\\\\
\purpleC{\text{total}} \div \greenD{\text{number of groups}} =\maroonD{\text{size of groups}} \\\\
\purpleC{\text{total}} \div \maroonD{\text{size of groups}} =\greenD{\text{number of groups}}
\end{align}$

In ${\greenD{?}} = \purpleC{56} \div \maroonD{8}$, the $\purpleC{\text{total}}$ is $\purpleC{56}$.

The $\maroonD{\text{size of the groups}}$ is ${\maroonD{8}}$.

![Tape diagram showing 56 is equal to question mark equal groups of 8](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/834895f4de4e564c0fabd0892b3f22122bc75142)

The $\greenD{\text{number of the groups}}$ is $\greenD{?}$.

Nora can use these multiplication equations:

- $\purpleC{56} = \greenD{{?}} \times \maroonD{8}$
- $\purpleC{56} = \maroonD{8} \times \greenD{{?}}$

question.content:
Nora wants to use multiplication to solve ${?} = 56 \div 8$.

**Which two multiplication equations can Nora use?**
